newsitem.title: USA: GPU sees Pa. coal power plant back Tuesday.
newsitem.headline: GPU sees Pa. coal power plant back Tuesday.

text.p: GPU Generation Inc said Tuesday it expected its 850 megawatt (MW) Conemaugh 1 coal-fired power plant to be back on line later today after tripping off line earlier Tuesday.
The plant, in Indiana County, Pa., tripped off line at 0252 EST following a turbine control problem.
"It tripped off line at 0252 (EST), and expected up about 1630 (EST)," a GPU Generation spokeswoman said.
The adjoining Conemaugh unit 2, also rated at 850 MW, was operating at full output, she added.
The Conemaugh complex is jointly owned by utility members of the Pennsylvania-New Jersey-Maryland Interconnect pool.
The Conemaugh units are operated by GPU Generation, a subsidiary of GPU Inc of Parisippany, N.J.
